page.title: 03Ecology-Urban & Moss Valley
page.content: The Moss Valley management project,set up by local authorities and the countryside commission,has a variety of habitats.These include rivers which support trout,crayfish and voles.Kingfishers and woodpeckers are quite common.Foxes,badgers,grey squirrels and rabbits are also to be found.The land to the north of White Lane is principally housing but foxes have been seen in the area. The pollution in the urban environment is high due to litter.A local survey showed that most people said they never dumped rubbish.Nobody knows if dangerous chemicals have been dumped.The local stream is polluted by mattresses,carpets,tyres,paper,bike frames and oil.The public Dumpit tip on Blackstock Rd. was opened in 1968, but this has not completely solved the rubbish problem!
